text: Aspic or meat jelly () is a savory gelatin made with a meat stock or broth, set in a mold to cover other ingredients. These often include pieces of meat, seafood, vegetable, or eggs. Aspic is also sometimes referred to as aspic gel√©e or aspic jelly. In its simplest form, aspic is essentially a gelatinous version of conventional soup. ==References== Category:Food ingredients
title: Aspic
